items.summary: Implement an admin-only backend maintenance operation to purge **all room data** for a single specified hotel without affecting any other hotels. The purge must delete every room record belonging to the target hotel (including all fields such as room number/type/price/currency/pictures) and must also remove those room IDs from the hotel’s stored room list so the hotel ends up with **zero rooms**.

Make the cleanup for the specific hotel named **"HOTEL DUMMY"** run as part of a safe, one-time backend upgrade cleanup (so it does not require any manual admin UI actions). The upgrade cleanup must locate the hotel record by name match "HOTEL DUMMY" and then perform the full room purge described in REQ-41, and persist a flag so the purge is not re-run on every upgrade.

Prevent ghost/placeholder rooms from appearing when a hotel’s stored room ID list references missing room records. Update hotel-to-room view construction so that room IDs that do not exist in `roomsMap` are excluded from `rooms` results (do not synthesize empty rooms with blank fields).

Add a targeted regression verification pass (manual is acceptable) to confirm the HOTEL DUMMY purge and ghost-room fix did not break unrelated flows, using the relevant portions of `frontend/REGRESSION_CHECKLIST.md` (auth, browse hotels, hotel profile, rooms, admin hotel visibility). Record results as a short checklist in the PR description or release notes.
